data.title: Cube mapping keeps zeroing out?
Viewport fixes.
data.body: Ok, I really dont know why Tom declain my previous commit about Viewport. So now I rewrite same thing but without comments and new constructors. Probably, now hes accept this.

data.title: GetData() error creating framebuffer
ContentManager Loading Extension
sRGB Gamma Support
data.body:
We would like to see gamma correct rendering support added to MonoGame.  Currently we do this entirely in the shaders...  doing the correct conversion to linear space and back to gamma as appropriate.  The problem is that this wastes shader instructions.

The better way to do this in DX11/GL is to create the textures and render targets using the _SRGB formats.  In this mode the GPU will automatically convert to linear and back to gamma as needed entirely in hardware and cheaper than using shader instructions.  It also allows the hardware to do gamma correct filtering.

To add this to MonoGame we would have to:
- Add the _SRGB formats to the PixelFormat enum.
- Fix the Texture/RenderTarget classes to create SRGB formats.
- Fix ContentManager.Load<> To Support Loading sRGB formats.

Thoughts?

data.title: Removed unused XML references on MonoGame Project's.
data.body: Removed to reduce final package size. It's just not needed on many platforms.

data.title: Fixed DX SetRenderTarget Bug
data.body:
This fix ensures that a render target cannot be bound as a render target and as a texture at the same time.

This is disallowed by DirectX and when you manage to do it would cause the render target apply to fail.  I don't think this same issue can occur on OpenGL because of how the API works, so I limited the fix to DirectX only until someone reports otherwise.

See #1868 for a sample that causes this to occur.

data.title: Critial Crash Fix
data.body:
My cleanup of `NotImplementedExceptions' in #1985 introduced a critical bug.  

This restores the previous behavior and adds comments to make it clear why it works like it does.

data.title: Fixes orientation changes for Android Tablets.
data.body:
This fixes the orientation changed event for Android Tablet.
This solution was found on MonoGame's CodePlex discussions.
I only adapted the solution to work on the actual MonoGame's version. All the credit goes to JohnHolmes.
I found the bug and, coincidentally, found the solution on the discussion board.
The error report:
https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/452578
And the fix, by JohnHolmes:
https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/444056
I just packet it all together, made a PR and submitted.
I've also tested this on a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2. Works flawlessly.

data.title: Removed PowerStatus
data.body:
And PowerLineStatus and BatteryCharge files.
These were part of XNA 3.0 and removed in 4.0.

data.title: NotImplementedException Cleanup
data.body:
This PR is largely cleanup of stub methods that provide no implementation and only throw the `NotImplementedException`.  These methods fool people into thinking that their port works at compile time, only to find exceptions at runtime.  See #1978.

I cleaned up `NotImplementedException`s in two ways:
- Methods that purely had no implementation on any platform were commented out.
- Fixed cases where a `NotImplementedException` was incorrectly used to defined an unexpected case in a switch statement.  We use `NotSupportedException` or `ArgumentException` where appropriate.

There are cases where the unimplemented code is in the middle of a larger statement, I left these alone.  Also places where the `NotImplementedException` occurred in an overridden method were left in as well.

I left the new content pipeline code alone...  it has a lot of `NotImplementedException`s, but it is still in heavy development.

While I was at it I implemented a few unimplemented methods that i came across and knew the right fix.
- GraphicsDeviceManager.BeginDraw()/EndDraw()
- DisplayModeCollection.GetEnumerator()
- EffectParameter.GetValueMatrixArray()
- EffectParameter.GetValueTextureCube()
- EffectParameter.SetValue(Quaternion)
- EffectParameter.GetValueQuaternion()
- AudioCategory.Equals() and related methods.

None of this changed existing functionality, so it should be safe to merge if all the platforms successfully compile.

data.title: Remove PowerStatus Implementations
data.body:
There seem to be 4 or 5 implementations of PowerStatus that are largely identical in implementation.  

While XNA 3.x had this class, it was removed in XNA 4.0.

Someone should delete these implementations and remove them from the projects.

data.title: Texture2D.GetData not working when SurfaceType is Texture
data.body:
When calling Texture2D.GetData, the returned color array is empty (zero-filled) due to the following commit:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1709/commits

If I remove the condition of the SurfaceType being RenderTarget (i.e. because the SurfaceType is Texture) I am able to retrieve color data as I do on any other platform.

Additionally, I also had to change line 604 of Texture2D.cs to the following:

```
frame_buffer.SetColorTarget(_texture2D, 0);
```

data.title: DynamicSoundEffectInstance for OpenAL
data.body:
We implemented DynamicSoundEffectInstance for OpenAL on Mac and iOS along with some integration tests.

We used a partial class to encapsulate the OpenAL specifics to keep the code more readable than using #if.

There is a race condition when rapidly playing and pausing that has been difficult to debug due to various issues with Xamarin Studio on Mac. Other than that issue, tests pass on Mac OS for playing, stopping, pausing, resuming, and looping clips.

TODO:

Test on PSM
Test on iOS
Integrate the existing DirectX pull request
Move more OpenAL calls into the OALSoundBuffer class

The TODO items might not all be required to integrate this pull request. I'd like to get input on what other work should be done on this patch.

data.title: SpriteBatch is not batching sprites - 2D poor performance
NullReferenceException when creating a Game Instance
data.body:
Hello guys. 
I am having a NullReferenceException when creating a Game instance: 

at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGameView.CreateFramebuffer () [0x001d6] in /Users/User/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/iOS/iOSGameView.cs:243 
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGameView.DidMoveToWindow () [0x00038] in /Users/User/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/iOS/iOSGameView.cs:365 
at (wrapper managed-to-native) MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Messaging:void_objc_msgSend_IntPtr (intptr,intptr,intptr) 
at MonoTouch.UIKit.UIView.AddSubview (MonoTouch.UIKit.UIView view) [0x00021] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/monotouch/src/UIKit/UIView.g.cs:429 
at MonoTouch.UIKit.UIView.Add (MonoTouch.UIKit.UIView view) [0x00000] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/monotouch/src/UIKit/UIView.cs:20 
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGamePlatform..ctor (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x000e0] in /Users/User/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/iOS/iOSGamePlatform.cs:119 
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Create (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00002] in /Users/User/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/GamePlatform.cs:92 
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game..ctor () [0x00210] in /Users/User/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/Game.cs:141 
at SampleGame.Game1..ctor () [0x00000] in /Users/User/Projects/SampleGame/SampleGame/Game1.cs:40 
at SampleGame.Program.FinishedLaunching (MonoTouch.UIKit.UIApplication app) [0x00003] in /Users/User/Projects/SampleGame/SampleGame/Main.cs:18 

Particularly, this code on iOSGameView.cs:243 : 
var gds = (IGraphicsDeviceService) platform.Game.Services.GetService(typeof (IGraphicsDeviceService)); 

It cant find an instance of IGraphicsDeviceService in the Game.Services. 
Any idea? 

NOTE:
This started when i updated my Xamarin.iOS version to 6.4.4.12.

data.title: What's the deal with the samples?
data.body:
Apologies if this is a dupe; I looked and didn't find anything that had been updated in the last 6 months.

I see that the Samples submodule has been pulled from the main repository; I take it this is a response to the fact that (as far as I could tell) the official samples were mostly broken for the last 3+ months.

What's the current plan/agenda for samples? How should someone who's trying to do development on MonoGame, or add a new platform, or get started porting a game, ensure they've got a working build of MonoGame and start testing things out?

Is the plan what I was told previously - to build a few new samples and throw out all the old ones? Are the old samples being iteratively refined into a working state, in a repo at a new location?

I'm coming back to the JSIL stuff after a short paying-the-bills lapse and I'm still in the state where I can't get any of the samples other than Draw2D to build or run against any platform other than WindowsGL, and that makes it difficult for me to make any progress implementing features like audio or input.

data.title: Comment Out NotImplementedException Methods
data.body:
We should comment out all methods in MonoGame that are purely stubs with a `throw new NotImplementedException` in them.

While this may be good practice in C#, it is not helpful for people trying to port from XNA.  They finally get everything to compile to later find some of the methods they need are empty stubs.  It is better for these users to fail at compile time then at runtime.

By commenting them out they serve as reminders of what needs to be done, but don't hurt users trying to port.

Now we cannot remove all `NotImplementedException`s as some are within branches of bigger methods...  those we just need to live with for now.

And of course the bigger goal is still to see these unimplemented methods be finished.  This is simply a short term improvement.

data.title: DirectX Debug Mode Fallback
data.body:
This is a simple fallback when you try to run a debug build of a WinDX or a WinStore app on a machine that doesn't have the DirectX debug runtime installed.  

Before it would simply crash and fail to run... now it disables the DirectX debug runtime and retries.

data.title: Added CheckAccess call to bypass wait when on the UI thread.
data.body: Verified this fixes the test case outlined in the issue.

data.title: Math Optimizations & Cleanups
data.body:
I have a few math optimizations and cleanups here.
- Inlined some math methods to remove function call overheads in debug and release.
- Removed duplicate implementations of methods...  non-`ref` methods should always call the `ref` version.
- Fixed cases where `ref` method was slower than non-`ref` method.

I submitted this now for feedback, but i expect to make more of these fixes in the coming weeks.  We can leave this open for a while i'll continue to add to it.

data.title: Fixed XAudio Shutdown
data.body:
Turns out that on the DirectX desktop builds which actually exit the game the XAudio system wasn't being correctly shutdown causing periodic crashes.

This didn't affect WP or WinStore because they don't exit the game.  The game is disposed when their task is killed off.

This shouldn't affect anything but the WinDX platform, but it wouldn't hurt for someone to test on WP and WinStore.

data.title: Relocate Platform Specific Code From Game to Platform
data.body: There is a disturbing amount of platform specific code that has leaked into the Game class.  This is what the Platform class is for.  We need someone to do some small refactors moving platform specific code out of Game and into the various Platform classes.

data.title: Replace MGFX DirectX Preprocessor With Portable One
data.body:
Currently the MGFX tools depend on the Microsoft DirectX Preprocessor API for resolving `#include`s, `#define`s, and such before the shader is compiled.

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Tools/2MGFX/ShaderInfo.cs#L400

We need to replace this preprocessor with one of our own that is portable to Mac and Linux and does not have a dependency on DirectX.

data.title: WP8 - Wait.WaitOne() on main thread during game resume
Hold gesture not captured on Windows Phone device
data.body:
It seems that GestureType.Hold is not captured. Tested with two Lumia 920's.

It appears that the test elapsed < _maxTicksToProcessHold in TouchPanel always succeeds, preventing the gesture from being added. Placing a breakpoint before the above test, allowing the clock to elapse, causes the test to fail and for the gesture to be added.
